markdown.markdown:
- [Taller Ciencia Abierta UValpo Enero 2024](https://uv.cl/archivo-noticias-uv/26426-director-de-investigacion-de-la-facultad-de-ciencias-sociales-uchile-dicto-taller-sobre-ciencia-abierta) - [CIPER 2019 La demanda por igualdad y los caminos que cuentan con amplio respaldo ciudadano](https://www.ciperchile.cl/2019/12/06/la-demanda-por-igualdad-y-los-caminos-que-cuentan-con-amplio-respaldo-ciudadano/) - “Notas sobre los resultados de Chile en la última prueba internacional de formación ciudadana”, con Daniel Miranda en [CIPER](https://ciperchile.cl/2017/12/28/notas-sobre-los-resultados-de-chile-en-la-ultima-prueba-internacional-de-formacion-ciudadana/) (Diciembre 2017). - “La meritocracia, ¿una tragedia?”, en [El Mostrador](http://www.elmostrador.cl/noticias/opinion/2017/08/21/la-meritocracia-una-tragedia) (Diciembre 2017). - Comentario al libro Desiguales (Larrañaga, Cociña & Frei, PNUD 2017), en [seminario COES-PNUD](https://youtu.be/f9yyLEiLIBY?t=2069), Octubre 2017. - “CASEN y Cohesión: oportunidades y precauciones”, con Mauro Basaure en [El Mostrador](http://www.elmostrador.cl/noticias/opinion/2016/09/29/casen-y-cohesion-oportunidades-y-precauciones/) (Septiembre 2016). - “La nueva Casen y las exigencias a la política social en Chile”, con Mauro Basaure en [El Dínamo](https://www.eldinamo.cl/blog/la-nueva-casen-y-las-exigencias-a-la-politica-social-en-chile/) (Octubre 2016). - “Selección en particulares y la complicidad de los psicólogos” en [El Mostrador](http://www.elmostrador.cl/noticias/opinion/2015/01/29/seleccion-en-particulares-y-la-complicidad-de-los-psicologs/) (Enero 2015). - “De la educación cívica a la educación para la ciudadanía”, en [El Mostrador](http://www.elmostrador.cl/noticias/opinion/2014/09/02/de-la-educacion-civica-a-la-educacion-para-la-ciudadania/) (Septiembre 2014) # Software I use software compatible with the principles of open science, this is, free and open source. ![](/images/logos.png) --- - My operating system is Linux, I use [Ubuntu](https://www.ubuntu.com/) with Gnome-[Cairo Dock](http://glx-dock.org/). A lot of freedom for customization ... and looks great. - For general statistical analysis and reporting I work in [R](https://cran.r-project.org/), using packages for data science from [Tidyverse](https://www.tidyverse.org/). - For more specific analysis: I use [lme4](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/lme4/index.html) for multilevel models and [Lavaan](http://lavaan.ugent.be/) for SEM. - I also use R's reproducibility tools as [Knitr](https://yihui.name/knitr/) & Rmarkdown ... before I used to be a fan of LaTeX, but the simplicity and efficiency of Markdown seems unbeatable, even for presentations with tools such as [remark](https://remarkjs.com/) & [Xaringan](https://slides.yihui.name/xaringan/) . - For writing (and almost for everything so far) I use [Atom](https://atom.io/) editor. Just great, and smooth with Git/Github. - Here a good introduction to version control with (plain) Git from: [Blischack & Wilson, 2016](https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1004668)
### Open Science - [Teaching Reproducibility 2022, special issue of the Journal of Statistics and Data Science Education](https://www.tandfonline.com/toc/ujse20/current) -[13 OPEN PUBLISHING TOOLS](https://www.annaclemens.com/blog/open-science-publishing-access-tools?utm_content=buffer366b2&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=buffer) -[Writing clean code](https://besjournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/2041-210X.13961) - [A large-scale study on research code quality and execution](https://arxiv.org/abs/2103.12793) - [Create, Publish, and Analyze Personal Websites Using R and RStudio](https://r4sites-book.netlify.app/) - [Ciencia reproducible: qué, por qué, cómo (Rodríguez-Sánchez et al, 2016)](https://doi.org/10.7818/ECOS.2016.25-2.11) - [Gates Open Research](https://gatesopenresearch.org/) - [Internal replication of computational workflows in scientific research](https://gatesopenresearch.org/articles/4-17/v2) - [Karl Broman Tutorias reproducibility, knitr, Git & more](https://kbroman.org/pages/tutorials.html) - [Open Science Framework](https://osf.io/) - [SocArxiv](https://socopen.org/welcome/), the open archive of the social sciences - [The Berkeley Initiative for Transparency in the Social Sciences](https://www.bitss.org/) - [ILDA - Iniciativa Latinoamericana por los Datos Abiertos](https://idatosabiertos.org/) - [Free our knowledge](http://freeourknowledge.org/) - [Paywall, the movie](https://paywallthemovie.com/) - [Open science training handbook](https://open-science-training-handbook.gitbook.io/book/) - [Unpaywall chrome extension](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/unpaywall/iplffkdpngmdjhlpjmppncnlhomiipha) (Identifica con un ícono cuando el artículo se encuentra libre de pago). - [Introduction to reproducible science in R, from Brian Lee Yung Rowe](https://cartesianfaith.files.wordpress.com/2018/11/rowe-introduction-to-reproducible-science-part-i-20181112.pdf) - [8 Easy Steps to Open Science: An Annotated Reading List](https://psyarxiv.com/cfzyx)
### Data analysis **Teaching resources** - [Teaching Methods Resources portal- Sage](https://teaching-methods.sagepub.com/) **Data wrangling, inference & modeling** -[Infer: Inferencia estadística en R](https://infer.netlify.app/) - [Introducción al procesamiento de datos con R para Ciencias Sociales](https://intro-r-eph.netlify.app/) - [Missing data and imputation: Missing Values in Clinical Research](https://nerler.github.io/EP16_Multiple_Imputation/practical/) - [Introduction to Modern Statistics (1st Ed)](https://openintro-ims.netlify.app/) -[Best Coding Practices for R](https://bookdown.org/content/d1e53ac9-28ce-472f-bc2c-f499f18264a3/) - [RTutor - Talk to your data via AI](http://rtutor.ai/) - [questionr: R package to make surveys processing easier](https://juba.github.io/questionr/articles/recoding_addins.html) - [esquisse: R Dashboard](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/esquisse/vignettes/get-started.html) - [package editData : An RStudio Addin for Editing A ‘data.frame’](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/editData/readme/README.html) -[Measurement invariance in the social sciences](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0049089X22001168?dgcid=coauthor) - [Introduction to Multilevel Modelling](https://www.learn-mlms.com/) - [Marginalia: Marginal effects in R, by Andrew Heiss](https://www.andrewheiss.com/blog/2022/05/20/marginalia/) - [DataEditR](https://github.com/DillonHammill/DataEditR) - [Radiant – Business analytics using R and Shiny](https://radiant-rstats.github.io/docs/) - [Autocorrelation Screening: A Potentially Efficient Method for Detecting Repetitive Response Patterns in Questionnaire Data](https://scholarworks.umass.edu/pare/vol27/iss1/2/)

Estimating a Parameter from a Random Sample pic.twitter.com/H2KxnLzDyH

— Chelsea Parlett-Pelleriti (@ChelseaParlett) December 15, 2020
- [Why should I use the here package when I'm already using projects?](https://malco.io/2018/11/05/why-should-i-use-the-here-package-when-i-m-already-using-projects/) - [Group comparisons](https://indrajeetpatil.github.io/ggstatsplot/articles/web_only/ggbetweenstats.html) - [R Syntax Comparison :: CHEAT SHEET](https://www.amelia.mn/Syntax-cheatsheet.pdf) - [Leveraging labelled data in R](https://www.pipinghotdata.com/posts/2020-12-23-leveraging-labelled-data-in-r/) - [Book IMS: Introduction to Modern Statistics](https://openintro-ims.netlify.app/) - [Book Tidy Modeling with R](https://www.tmwr.org/) - [explorer: R package for exploring data with a Shiny app](https://rolkra.github.io/start-to-explore/) - [R modelsummary](https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/modelsummary/) - [Modern R with the tidyverse](https://b-rodrigues.github.io/modern_R/) - [Libro (bookdown): Introducción a la ciencia de Datos, de Rafael Irizarry](https://rafalab.github.io/dslibro/) - [Teach R Interactive courses](https://education.rstudio.com/blog/2020/05/teach-interactive-course/) - [Applied R in the classroom](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/1467-8462.12362) - [*lmeresampler*: R package for resampling multilevel models](http://aloy.github.io/lmeresampler/) - [How to standardize variables in R](https://data-se.netlify.app/2021/02/26/how-to-standardize-variables-in-r/) **Visualization** - [Replicar grafico desde imagen con R con ask](https://x.com/RosanaFerrero/status/1842123728668262696?t=wzlHpiCU6_KbfTMUCdOawg&s=03) - [Correlations, from easystats](https://easystats.github.io/blog/posts/correlation_presentation/) - [reactablefmtr: Streamlined Table Styling and Formatting for {reactable}](https://rpubs.com/kcuilla/reactablefmtr-socal-presentation?s=03) - [R Graph Gallery](https://r-graph-gallery.com/) - [ggstatsplot](https://indrajeetpatil.github.io/ggstatsplot/) - [Creating beautiful tables in R with {gt}](https://gt.albert-rapp.de/) - [5 CSS Animation libraries for every developer](https://animate.style/) - [Guess the correlation](http://guessthecorrelation.com/) - [Multilevel models visualization](http://mfviz.com/hierarchical-models/) - [BEAUTIFUL AND INFORMATIVE DATA VISUALISATION](https://ourcodingclub.github.io/tutorials/datavis/) - [esquisse: ggplot2 builder addin](https://dreamrs.github.io/esquisse/) - [ggstatsplot: ggplot2 Based Plots with Statistical Details](https://github.com/IndrajeetPatil/ggstatsplot) - [rtist: fancy color palettes in R graphs](https://github.com/tomasokal/rtist) - [Designing GGplots - con una muy buena presentación en Xaringan](https://designing-ggplots.netlify.app/#1) - [ggdist](https://mjskay.github.io/ggdist/) - [Seeing Theory](https://seeing-theory.brown.edu/index.html#secondPage) - [RStats illustrations](https://github.com/allisonhorst/stats-illustrations) - [teacups-giraffes-and-statistics](https://tinystats.github.io/teacups-giraffes-and-statistics/index.html) - [ExPanDaR, interactive analysis](https://joachim-gassen.github.io/2019/12/explore-your-data-with-expand/) - [Workshop Designing ggplots](https://github.com/malcolmbarrett/designing.ggplots) - [ThinkR, data visualization with R](https://thinkr.biz/) - [SEM diagrams in R](http://rich-iannone.github.io/DiagrammeR/modification.html), see also [this](https://rpubs.com/tjmahr/sem_diagrammer). - [Graphics principles cheatsheet](https://graphicsprinciples.github.io/) - [Practical ggplot](https://wilkelab.org/practicalgg/) **Reporting, workflows & communication** - [Telling Stories with Data - Online Book](https://tellingstorieswithdata.com) - [dataReporter: R package for documenting and creating reports on data cleanliness](https://github.com/ekstroem/dataReporter) - [Building reproducible analytical pipelines with R](https://raps-with-r.dev/) - [Fallibility in Science: Responding to Errors in the Work of Oneself and Others](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/2515245918776632) -[Writing a scientific article: A step-by-step guide for beginners](https://www.iium.edu.my/media/74156/B-5%20%20Writing%20a%20Scientific%20Article%20for%20Index%20Journal%20from%20IIUM%20Library..pdf) - [Business Reports with R Markdown](https://meetup-rmd-style-business-report.netlify.app/?panelset1=previous-css2#1) - [Reporting model parameters](https://thiyanga.netlify.app/post/regoutputs/) with [`parameters` library](https://easystats.github.io/parameters/index.html) - [distill: article writing in RMarkdown](https://rstudio.github.io/distill/basics.html) - [remedy - add-in for markdown writing in RStudio](https://github.com/ThinkR-open/remedy) - [Xaringan slides sharing](https://www.garrickadenbuie.com/blog/sharing-xaringan-slides/) - [XaringanExtra](https://pkg.garrickadenbuie.com/xaringanExtra/) - [Flipbooks in Xaringan](https://evamaerey.github.io/little_flipbooks_library/about/what_the_flipbook) - [Pimp my RMD](https://holtzy.github.io/Pimp-my-rmd/) - [workflowr: organized + reproducible + shareable data science in R](https://github.com/jdblischak/workflowr) - [Making R & Python work in Atom](https://jstaf.github.io/2018/03/25/atom-ide.html) - [Robert Mitchell's tutorial to build rmarkown websites](http://robertmitchellv.com/blog-building-site-with-rmarkdown.html) - [Emily Zabor's tutorial to build rmarkown websites](http://www.emilyzabor.com/tutorials/rmarkdown_websites_tutorial.html) ## Writing, literature reviews, publication & others - ver ahora en: [https://jc-castillo.com/post/escritura-academica/](https://jc-castillo.com/post/escritura-academica/) ## Teaching & resources - [Statistics & R cartoons by Allison Horst](https://allisonhorst.com/) - [Flinga board](https://flinga.fi/) - [Menti](https://www.menti.com/) - [Quarto for Academics](https://quarto.org/docs/blog/posts/2023-05-22-quarto-for-academics/) ## Survey research - [ChatGPTest: Opportunities and Cautionary Tales of Utilizing AI for Questionnaire Pretesting](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/1525822X241280574?s=03) ### Following people - [Kieran Healy](https://kieranhealy.org/) - [Yihui Xie](https://github.com/yihui) - [Leslie McCall](https://www.gc.cuny.edu/stonecenter/Leslie-McCall) ## Procrastinación - [Circles](https://www.circles.gallery/create) - [Sombras](https://sombras.app/)

# Newspapers articles, news, comments & opinions - [Taller Ciencia Abierta UValpo Enero 2024](https://uv.cl/archivo-noticias-uv/26426-director-de-investigacion-de-la-facultad-de-ciencias-sociales-uchile-dicto-taller-sobre-ciencia-abierta) - [CIPER 2019 La demanda por igualdad y los caminos que cuentan con amplio respaldo ciudadano](https://www.ciperchile.cl/2019/12/06/la-demanda-por-igualdad-y-los-caminos-que-cuentan-con-amplio-respaldo-ciudadano/) - “Notas sobre los resultados de Chile en la última prueba internacional de formación ciudadana”, con Daniel Miranda en [CIPER](https://ciperchile.cl/2017/12/28/notas-sobre-los-resultados-de-chile-en-la-ultima-prueba-internacional-de-formacion-ciudadana/) (Diciembre 2017). - “La meritocracia, ¿una tragedia?”, en [El Mostrador](http://www.elmostrador.cl/noticias/opinion/2017/08/21/la-meritocracia-una-tragedia) (Diciembre 2017). - Comentario al libro Desiguales (Larrañaga, Cociña & Frei, PNUD 2017), en [seminario COES-PNUD](https://youtu.be/f9yyLEiLIBY?t=2069), Octubre 2017. - “CASEN y Cohesión: oportunidades y precauciones”, con Mauro Basaure en [El Mostrador](http://www.elmostrador.cl/noticias/opinion/2016/09/29/casen-y-cohesion-oportunidades-y-precauciones/) (Septiembre 2016). - “La nueva Casen y las exigencias a la política social en Chile”, con Mauro Basaure en [El Dínamo](https://www.eldinamo.cl/blog/la-nueva-casen-y-las-exigencias-a-la-politica-social-en-chile/) (Octubre 2016). - “Selección en particulares y la complicidad de los psicólogos” en [El Mostrador](http://www.elmostrador.cl/noticias/opinion/2015/01/29/seleccion-en-particulares-y-la-complicidad-de-los-psicologs/) (Enero 2015). - “De la educación cívica a la educación para la ciudadanía”, en [El Mostrador](http://www.elmostrador.cl/noticias/opinion/2014/09/02/de-la-educacion-civica-a-la-educacion-para-la-ciudadania/) (Septiembre 2014) # Software I use software compatible with the principles of open science, this is, free and open source. ![](/images/logos.png) --- - My operating system is Linux, I use [Ubuntu](https://www.ubuntu.com/) with Gnome-[Cairo Dock](http://glx-dock.org/). A lot of freedom for customization ... and looks great. - For general statistical analysis and reporting I work in [R](https://cran.r-project.org/), using packages for data science from [Tidyverse](https://www.tidyverse.org/). - For more specific analysis: I use [lme4](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/lme4/index.html) for multilevel models and [Lavaan](http://lavaan.ugent.be/) for SEM. - I also use R's reproducibility tools as [Knitr](https://yihui.name/knitr/) & Rmarkdown ... before I used to be a fan of LaTeX, but the simplicity and efficiency of Markdown seems unbeatable, even for presentations with tools such as [remark](https://remarkjs.com/) & [Xaringan](https://slides.yihui.name/xaringan/) . - For writing (and almost for everything so far) I use [Atom](https://atom.io/) editor. Just great, and smooth with Git/Github. - Here a good introduction to version control with (plain) Git from: [Blischack & Wilson, 2016](https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1004668)
### Open Science - [Teaching Reproducibility 2022, special issue of the Journal of Statistics and Data Science Education](https://www.tandfonline.com/toc/ujse20/current) -[13 OPEN PUBLISHING TOOLS](https://www.annaclemens.com/blog/open-science-publishing-access-tools?utm_content=buffer366b2&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=buffer) -[Writing clean code](https://besjournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/2041-210X.13961) - [A large-scale study on research code quality and execution](https://arxiv.org/abs/2103.12793) - [Create, Publish, and Analyze Personal Websites Using R and RStudio](https://r4sites-book.netlify.app/) - [Ciencia reproducible: qué, por qué, cómo (Rodríguez-Sánchez et al, 2016)](https://doi.org/10.7818/ECOS.2016.25-2.11) - [Gates Open Research](https://gatesopenresearch.org/) - [Internal replication of computational workflows in scientific research](https://gatesopenresearch.org/articles/4-17/v2) - [Karl Broman Tutorias reproducibility, knitr, Git & more](https://kbroman.org/pages/tutorials.html) - [Open Science Framework](https://osf.io/) - [SocArxiv](https://socopen.org/welcome/), the open archive of the social sciences - [The Berkeley Initiative for Transparency in the Social Sciences](https://www.bitss.org/) - [ILDA - Iniciativa Latinoamericana por los Datos Abiertos](https://idatosabiertos.org/) - [Free our knowledge](http://freeourknowledge.org/) - [Paywall, the movie](https://paywallthemovie.com/) - [Open science training handbook](https://open-science-training-handbook.gitbook.io/book/) - [Unpaywall chrome extension](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/unpaywall/iplffkdpngmdjhlpjmppncnlhomiipha) (Identifica con un ícono cuando el artículo se encuentra libre de pago). - [Introduction to reproducible science in R, from Brian Lee Yung Rowe](https://cartesianfaith.files.wordpress.com/2018/11/rowe-introduction-to-reproducible-science-part-i-20181112.pdf) - [8 Easy Steps to Open Science: An Annotated Reading List](https://psyarxiv.com/cfzyx)
### Data analysis **Teaching resources** - [Teaching Methods Resources portal- Sage](https://teaching-methods.sagepub.com/) **Data wrangling, inference & modeling** -[Infer: Inferencia estadística en R](https://infer.netlify.app/) - [Introducción al procesamiento de datos con R para Ciencias Sociales](https://intro-r-eph.netlify.app/) - [Missing data and imputation: Missing Values in Clinical Research](https://nerler.github.io/EP16_Multiple_Imputation/practical/) - [Introduction to Modern Statistics (1st Ed)](https://openintro-ims.netlify.app/) -[Best Coding Practices for R](https://bookdown.org/content/d1e53ac9-28ce-472f-bc2c-f499f18264a3/) - [RTutor - Talk to your data via AI](http://rtutor.ai/) - [questionr: R package to make surveys processing easier](https://juba.github.io/questionr/articles/recoding_addins.html) - [esquisse: R Dashboard](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/esquisse/vignettes/get-started.html) - [package editData : An RStudio Addin for Editing A ‘data.frame’](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/editData/readme/README.html) -[Measurement invariance in the social sciences](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0049089X22001168?dgcid=coauthor) - [Introduction to Multilevel Modelling](https://www.learn-mlms.com/) - [Marginalia: Marginal effects in R, by Andrew Heiss](https://www.andrewheiss.com/blog/2022/05/20/marginalia/) - [DataEditR](https://github.com/DillonHammill/DataEditR) - [Radiant – Business analytics using R and Shiny](https://radiant-rstats.github.io/docs/) - [Autocorrelation Screening: A Potentially Efficient Method for Detecting Repetitive Response Patterns in Questionnaire Data](https://scholarworks.umass.edu/pare/vol27/iss1/2/)

Online Book](https://tellingstorieswithdata.com) - [dataReporter: R package for documenting and creating reports on data cleanliness](https://github.com/ekstroem/dataReporter) - [Building reproducible analytical pipelines with R](https://raps-with-r.dev/) - [Fallibility in Science: Responding to Errors in the Work of Oneself and Others](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/10.1177/2515245918776632) -[Writing a scientific article: A step-by-step guide for beginners](https://www.iium.edu.my/media/74156/B-5%20%20Writing%20a%20Scientific%20Article%20for%20Index%20Journal%20from%20IIUM%20Library..pdf) - [distill: article writing in RMarkdown](https://rstudio.github.io/distill/basics.html) - [remedy - add-in for markdown writing in RStudio](https://github.com/ThinkR-open/remedy) - [Xaringan slides sharing](https://www.garrickadenbuie.com/blog/sharing-xaringan-slides/) - [XaringanExtra](https://pkg.garrickadenbuie.com/xaringanExtra/) - [Flipbooks in Xaringan](https://evamaerey.github.io/little_flipbooks_library/about/what_the_flipbook) - [Pimp my RMD](https://holtzy.github.io/Pimp-my-rmd/) - [workflowr: organized + reproducible + shareable data science in R](https://github.com/jdblischak/workflowr) - [Making R & Python work in Atom](https://jstaf.github.io/2018/03/25/atom-ide.html) - [Robert Mitchell's tutorial to build rmarkown websites](http://robertmitchellv.com/blog-building-site-with-rmarkdown.html) - [Emily Zabor's tutorial to build rmarkown websites](http://www.emilyzabor.com/tutorials/rmarkdown_websites_tutorial.html) ## Writing, literature reviews, publication & others - ver ahora en: [https://jc-castillo.com/post/escritura-academica/](https://jc-castillo.com/post/escritura-academica/) ## Teaching & resources -
